Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery lekanis or lekane; glaze fired red-brown; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of dolphin (head with added red remaining) to left; one incised splinter rosette and incised blob as filling ornament; exterior: glazed.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 91, no. A118, pl. LXIV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.110) (Phase 1)
